column2: It\xc2\x92s a tradition here on Friends after every taping for me to\nhang out with you guys, (They all laugh) talk down the episode umm\xc2\x85 The point of this\nwhole thing is what people see in America is
Once and a while.'
From time to time.'
For example, I don\xc2\x92t have to memorize lines. You guys actually have\nto remember what to say and you probably forget from time to time. Yes?'

Our energy just comes way up when there\xc2\x92s an audience here and\nwhen that happens, something happens between your brain and your mouth sometimes and it\njust doesn\xc2\x92t, it just doesn\xc2\x92t work.'
Uh, oh-oh, umm no you didn\xc2\x92t. I did.'
Oh uh-uh, no-no-no-no-uh-uh. (He starts laughing, causing everyone\nelse to laugh.)'
So, we realize that\xc2\x97Oh no\xc2\x85 (She resets herself) I\xc2\x92m\ntelling it! I\xc2\x92m telling it\xc2\x85 (She loses it.)'
Ha-ha. Look\xc2\x97Come on, I don\xc2\x92t know what to do\xc2\x85or say. (He\nlaughs.)'
Ha-ha, very funny. I don\xc2\x92t know what to do! Y\xc2\x92know? Holy crud!'
Ha-ha-ha, very funny. Look, I don\xc2\x92t know what to do! (Long pause, as\neveryone cracks up.)'
It is one of those days!'
\xc2\x91Xcusa seniora, voulez-bere quakay\xc2\x97[Beep]\xc2\x97uck it!'
Wow Pheebs, you-you speak gutter?'
You still get nervous everybody just before a show?'
Absolutely.'
Everybody.'

It\xc2\x92s amazing like all week long we\xc2\x92ve-we\xc2\x92ve been saying
the same lines and then the audience is here and we will mess up, and if you mess up once,
then you\xc2\x92ll get nervous because you\xc2\x92ll\xc2\x97you know you\xc2\x92ll probably mess
up again.'
Action!'
(holding her hand in front of her face) When you were little you slept\nthrough-through the Grand Canyon.'
Watch again that hand.'
This\xc2\x92ll be five/ten takes.'
Okay.'
Okay. You know it\xc2\x92s gonna happen.'
Once again, and action!'
(the hand\xc2\x92s still there) When-when you were little you slept\nthrough the Grand Canyon. (She actually itches her nose this time.)'
Oh! Okay! I\xc2\x92m gonna try it without the coffee cup \xc2\x91cause I\nthink it\xc2\x92s the left hand that\xc2\x92s messing me up.'
When you were little you slept through the Grand\xc2\x97(Pointing\nagain)\xc2\x97Oh fffff\xc2\x85.'
Sorry, let\xc2\x92s go back! \xc2\x91Cause you\xc2\x92ve got more to say.'
Do I? Absolutely. Absolutely. Yeah, that\xc2\x92s your fault. I\xc2\x85say.'
I love you.'
I love you! (They hug.)'
But there must be, there must\xc2\x97are a lot of moments over the years\nwhere you\xc2\x92re just trying to do your job, something goes wrong.'
Hey and, this is a little extra something for y\xc2\x92know, always being\nthere for me.'
Hey Joey! The camera hit our wall!'
What?!'
Ahh! Sh\xc2\x97(Beep)\xc2\x97it that hurt!'
Are you okay?'
Hey Rach! (She breaks up and goes back into Monica\xc2\x92s.)'
Oh yeah? Then how come I keep\xc2\x97(He notices that the marker board they\nuse has been left on the entertainment center and holds up his discovery.)'
It was so wild! We told \xc2\x91em we were the Gunderson\xc2\x92s in\n16\xc2\x85'
(laughing) I spit on her!'
(to Lisa) Operation. You had a fun one.'
Oh yeah!'
With Operation.'
It was a little game. Yeah, with an electric buzzer.'
Oh-ooh, and I brought Operation, but umm I lost the umm\xc2\x85 (It\nstarts buzzing) It\xc2\x92s making a noise.'
But le Blanc really doesn\xc2\x92t mess up much.'
You don\xc2\x92t verbally mess up, but sometimes physically? You mess up.'
I have had some clumsy moments I guess you can call \xc2\x91em.'
He fell down once! And we re-did it and we went back. And\nhe\xc2\x97(laughs)\xc2\x97he was afraid he was gonna fall down\xc2\x85'
You could actually see him trying not to fall down.'
Pheebs! (He looks down as he goes down the step to make sure he\ndidn\xc2\x92t fall again.) Check it out! (He starts laughing when he realized what he did.)'
This particular time when he continued to fall or y\xc2\x92know, try not\nto fall, I was in the room with Matthew and Matthew was like, "Should I do it?"'
Pheebs! Check it out! Check it out! Check it out! Check it out! (Hands her\none.)'
Ooh, Soap Opera Digest!'

Matthew, you have a reputation with the rest of the cast that sometimes\nyou like to, you like to fool around a bit. I mean like if something\xc2\x92s naturally\ngoing wrong you like to get in there and juice it a little bit. True or false?'
I don\xc2\x92t necessarily like to juice things\xc2\x85'
He said true or false!'
Oh! Ooh-ooh!'
What are you doing?!'
You\xc2\x92re still a tiny bit on fire there.'
Oh geez! Okay! Thanks!'
It was great seeing you the other night.'
Well, it was good to see you too. Did you come down here to tell me\nthat?'
Noo! I came down here to tell you something else. I came here\nto tell you I still love you.'
What the fu\xc2\x97(beep)\xc2\x97ck are you doing?!'
Now you guys work with animals a lot. You had to work early on with a\nmonkey\xc2\x85'
That damn monkey.'
That damn monkey.'

Okay. Okay, see now the one with the feather boa? That\xc2\x92s Dr.\nFrancis. She used to be a man. Oh look! There\xc2\x97(Marcel (Katie) jumps away)\xc2\x97Okay.\n(And runs behind her on the back of the couch for a little while.) '
Katie. Geez! See Katie, come here\xc2\x97Katie! (Katie spills some\npopcorn.) Katie, come here Katie. (She obeys and sits where she\xc2\x92s supposed to.) Very\ngood.'
Lisa\xc2\x92s laugh though\xc2\x85There\xc2\x92s\xc2\x97It\xc2\x92s so\ninfectious. It\xc2\x92s one of those things\xc2\x85just forget about it. Once it starts,\nit\xc2\x92s all gone.'
No y\xc2\x92know, I don\xc2\x92t want to switch! Come on! I can throw wet\npaper towels here!'
Well at Monica\xc2\x92s you can eat\xc2\x97(Suddenly cracks up.)'
Okay, shh yeah. \xc2\x91Cause it\xc2\x92s not silly.'
Here we go.'
Okay.'
And\xc2\x85action!'
No-no Ph-Ph-Ph-Ph\xc2\x85 (She starts laughing.)'
(to Lisa) Ready?'
Yeah.'
And then it just builds on itself and there\xc2\x92s no doing the scene\nafter. I mean you probably wait and really get it together and do it.'
For me, I have a hard time with le Blanc in particular. When-when\xc2\x97I\nmean when\xc2\x85'
(to Matt) You bastard.'
Yeah, what did I do?'
\xc2\x85I keep a straight face he-he delivers like this look, a reaction to\nyou, or a certain take, I-I\xc2\x97I mean I find it so funny.'
Mornin\xc2\x92'
Mornin\xc2\x92'
I mean what kind of an actor, what kind of an actor can\xc2\x92t even say,\n"Hmm, noodle soup?"'
That\xc2\x92s a good one? (They both laugh.)'
Now, we should go back and take the other line.'
Okay, I\xc2\x92ll just put a little more booze on there. (Pours some more\non.)'
I think, subconsciously\xc2\x85'
(cracking up) Nope, you lost me.'
No! Come on!'

Okay, the next situation is for Rachel. The wedding is about to start you\nwalk into the back room and you find Monica taking a nap with Ross. (Ross lies on the\nfloor.) I\xc2\x92ll be Monica. Go! (He jumps down and cuddles up with Ross.)'
(jumping up) No! No! No!'
We\xc2\x92ll be right back with more Friends, less me.'
I\xc2\x92m doing my brother.'
That\xc2\x92s\xc2\x85gross.'
You uh, you\xc2\x92ve worked with\xc2\x97They always say a performer should\nnever work with pets or children.'
Aww, the kids.'
Action.'
Okay. Now\xc2\x97What is my first line?'
(prompting her) What did we agree?'
Okay\xc2\x85'
The good thing about the young kids though, they\xc2\x92re completely\nunpredictable. Which is a lot of fun as an actor to respond with. But there was one\nstory\xc2\x85'
Oh little Ben.'

Where the story was that I was anticipating that I would be around to\nhear my son\xc2\x92s first words spoken. But the scene was about that he wasn\xc2\x92t\nsupposed to be able to speak and, uh for some reason when we started doing the show\xc2\x85'
Hi! We\xc2\x92re visiting!'
Yay!'
It\xc2\x92s Ben and his Da-Da. Da-Da? Can you say Da-Da? Y\xc2\x92know, you\nmight as well say it because I told your\xc2\x85'
Da\xc2\x85Da.'
Can you say Da-Da? See, I\xc2\x92m gonna tell your mommies you said it\nanyway, so you might as well try\xc2\x85'
Da\xc2\x85Da.'
Huh?'
Da\xc2\x85Da.'
Yeah, he\xc2\x92s saying Da-Da.'

And then sometimes during the show y\xc2\x92know but you\xc2\x92re like, the\nscene\xc2\x92s going one way but you\xc2\x92re just tempted to say something another time.\nLike, do you remember that one where Monica\xc2\x92s baking cookies in our old apartment?'
She\xc2\x92s trying to intrigue us to hang out with her.'

Yeah, she\xc2\x92s trying to waft the smell across the hall to get us to\ncome hang out in her new place, and we\xc2\x92re sitting there eating pizza and I think it\nwas you (Points to Lisa) that said\xc2\x85'
What do I smell?'
I think I was supposed to say, "I don\xc2\x92t know," and go over\nand open the door. And I went\xc2\x85'
What do I smell?'
(Pause) Sorry. (Raises his hand in shame.)'
(everyone laughs) And then it was like four takes later before we could\nget through it with a straight face.'
What do I smell?'
Le Blanc.'
What do I smell?'
I don\xc2\x92t know, but it smells good. (He gets up and heads for the door\nonly to stop short and start laughing.)'
But audiences\xc2\x97You have a live studio audience and they must love\nthat. They must love it when they see you guys playing.'
What are you guys doing?'
Nothing.'
Nothin\xc2\x92.'
So that you will intentionally do something\nthat\xc2\x97they\xc2\x92ll-they\xc2\x92ll intentionally screw it up?'
Yeah!'
Yeah!'
(noticing the laughter) Why? What\xc2\x92s the matter?'
(to Courtney) You-you\xc2\x92ve worn a fat suit on the show. And, a lot of\npeople love you in the fat suit. Do you like wearing the fat suit? Is it fun?'
I\xc2\x92m melting!'
They made me dance, in the fat suit.'

I-I heard some of you guys talking about this earlier, but sometimes\nthere\xc2\x92s just a word that someone has to say that you\xc2\x92ll get hung up on. And\nit\xc2\x92ll just\xc2\x97the way you say the word is funny to everybody else.'
That tastes like feet!'
It tastes like (mimicking him in a high-pitched voice) feet!'
Okay, we\xc2\x92re good.'
Action!'
That tastes like feet!'

Sometimes the dialogue itself is just so funny and
you\xc2\x92ll\xc2\x97we\xc2\x92ll be rehearsing during the week and you
just\xc2\x97whatever-whatever the joke is; it\xc2\x92s so funny we can\xc2\x92t get through it
in rehearsal and just\xc2\x85'
You just know.'
You-you mentally make a flag on it and you say, "Okay show night,\nI\xc2\x92m just\xc2\x97I\xc2\x92ll never be able to get through this."'
Are you saying that you don\xc2\x92t want to get with this?'
You see, I don\xc2\x92t say\xc2\x97(Starts laughing.)'
(spitting the cookie out onto a napkin) Oh, sweet\nJe\xc2\x97(Beep)\xc2\x97sus! Oh! Monica, these are the (laughing) cookies they serve in hell!'

Oh yeah, and she\xc2\x92s really nice too! She taught me about y\xc2\x92know,\nhow to work with the cameras and smell-the-fart acting.'
Joey?'
I\xc2\x92m sorry\xc2\x85'
Excuse me, what?'
When you have to do physical business for a scene, I mean there must be;\nthere must be a lot of funny moments when you have to physically do a task as part of a\nscene.'

Yeah, Rachel, Chandler, and Ross had to try to get a couch up a\nstair\xc2\x97a very narrow New York stairwell and that was probably\xc2\x85I-I think it was\nthe hardest I\xc2\x92ve-I\xc2\x92ve laughed in my life period.'
Pivot! (They pivot) Pivot! (They pivot) Okay, pivot! Piv-at! (He starts\nlaughing.)'
Pivot! Piv-at! Piv-at!!'
Shut up! Shut up! Shut up!!'
Pivat!! (In a high pitched voice) Pivat!!!'
You\xc2\x92ve done over 150 episodes, but your favorite moments that 80\nyears from now you\xc2\x92ll be thinking about?'
It is when we\xc2\x92re able to crack each other up.'
Monica\xc2\x92s gotta have the phone in the right place\nand\xc2\x97(Frantic babbling.)'
(To Chandler) All right! All right! All right! (To Joey) We are\nfixing it. '
He\xc2\x92s gone. He\xc2\x92s\xc2\x85 '
We enjoy watching each other. And I settle for watching each other\xc2\x92s\nperformance, and we like each other.'
Oh the band\xc2\x92s ready! And well\xc2\x97I-I\xc2\x97we gotta do what the band\nsays, right? I don\xc2\x92t care about the stinkin\xc2\x92 band!!'
Okay Friends gang, thanks for doing it.'
Well thank you so much.'
Thank you Conan!'
Well thank for coming here, it\xc2\x92s good to see you.'
Thank you my babies. (Waves good-bye.)'
Oh what are doing?!'
You\xc2\x92re still a tiny bit on fire there!'
I think you got it!'
I\xc2\x92m sorry, I messed up.'
I\xc2\x92ll do it again and again if you want.'
No-no! I\xc2\x92ll-I\xc2\x92ll\xc2\x85 (He takes too much and some falls out of\nhis mouth, which starts him laughing.)'
That is too much!'
Let me start that again.'
